column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=How do you break your novel out ?
#Text=How do you get it to stand apart ?
#Text=I ca n't think about it that way .
#Text=It 's very simple : All I do is write .
#Text=The way that I go about doing my work is very simple .
#Text=Imagine that somebody told you that some book was great , or a movie was great , or a play was great , but they did n't tell you anything about it .
#Text=You 're on your way there to see it or hear it or read it , and in your mind , you 're already imagining what it 's going to be like .
#Text=That 's what I write .
#Text=I write the stuff that I wish were up there because I 'm so often disappointed .
#Text=I 'm just trying to write the thing that would make me happy , you know , as if it was an audience of a hundred thousand of me out there , what they want to read .
#Text=That is n't necessarily what everybody does .
#Text=Although I think any successful writer has to be enthusiastic about their own writing .
#Text=But you might be writing in terms of , " Oh this is going to be my big blockbuster novel " or something .
#Text=Or if you have a particular point that you want to make .
#Text=Some sort of allegory or some sort of commentary on society .
#Text=Well , my stuff reflects the way that I think and exist .
#Text=It 's a little philosophical , but it 's a little punk as well because I really believe in having a sense of humor about the world , even though it does n't reflect in the way I talk .
#Text=I just think that humor in people and philosophy is what it 's all about .
#Text=I push the envelope a little bit .
#Text=It just has to be entertaining , and entertaining can be whatever holds an audience .
#Text=And that might be ideas , or it might be sex or it might be terrific writing --
#Text=obviously , I want my writing to be able to hold up when you read it .
#Text=How Bogosian works himself into his writing
#Text=Would you describe yourself as an experience junkie ?
#Text=An experience junkie ?
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=[ Laughs ]
#Text=Uh , well , I think I always did think of myself that way , but I know there 's so many things that I actually do n't know anything about .
#Text=I 'm typical of the suburban know-it-alls that showed up in the cities twenty years ago and think of themselves as sort of on the edge , but really are so typical , it 's embarrassing .
#Text=I went to college and I did drugs and I lived in the city , so big deal .
#Text=Me and ninety million other people did the same thing .
#Text=It is n't like I climbed Mount Everest or I fought in a war or did anything genuinely interesting .
#Text=As fiction moves more and more toward this first-person type of fiction , then it becomes this competition of who 's had the most exciting life or did the most exciting things .
#Text=And for me , that 's not where literature comes from .
